Subject: Best seeds for a domain crawl
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=278860915
From: Colin Rosenthal <csr@...>

Hi,

I was wondering if anybody had ideas, or even tools, for finding the 
best seeds for a domain crawl. Some of the issues we're thinking about:

Given a domain foobar.com:

A first guess set of seeds might be
http://foobar.com
http://www.foobar.com
https://foobar.com
https://www.foobar.com

Depending on how the server is set up, any or all of these might fail 
(404). Any or all of these might redirect to one of the others. Also any 
or all
of these might redirect to a page on the same domain or another domain, 
e.g. http://foobar.barfoo.com. This would be a problem if your scope was 
tightly focused on the seed domain.

My gut feeling is that if you include as seeds any of the 4 basic seeds 
that work (ie don't 404) + the full chain of redirects then you should 
be ok. But
have I missed out any unusual or pathological cases? Does anyone have a 
tool for generating such seed lists from a list of domains?

regards,

Colin Rosenthal
Senior IT Consultant
Netarkivet/State & University Library Denmark
